review: Came in for dinner on sat the 13 with dam it  again attitude but they nailed it for the first time in a long time it was good not burned food  Kim  bartender was tops

Went for the all you can eat ribs . You better pack a pillow and blanket because you might want to take a nap in between the time it took for the ribs to come to the table. It was ridiculous. Don't advertise them if you can't serve them. By the time you put an order in and wait, you aren't hungry anymore, I think that is their plan. Will NOT be back. Terrible service.
I've eaten at Applebee's all over the country and this one is just like all of the rest. Service was good and the bourbon street steak was as good.

I don't mind Applebee's every now and then but this location is awful. I've been three times, all three times my party was asked to wait ten or fifteen minutes to be seated despite the restaurant being nearly empty. All three times we were seated and waited fifteen minutes or more for drinks to come out. And all three times we, for one reason or another, had to wait over one hour from the time we arrived until our food was brought out. Not acceptable. To add insult to injury, not one time did everyone I was with get exactly what they ordered. All three times our order was wrong, and on all three occasions the bill was not correct either, and we either had to make a stink or just pay it to get out of there. Three times was enough for me to realize that is just business as usual at this location. I won't be back.

Worst food experience i've had in a long time.  I ordered the New York strip, medium and a salad and asked if they could put feta  cheese on my salad, which they said they didn't have. Now i was ok with that but when our server brought my steak to me it looked rubbery i guess is the best way to describe it....when i cut into it there was no pink center...it was gray...and obviously been laying jn the freezer for quite a while. I did not cause a scene but just told my server and explained all i wanted was a fresh one, which she brought out about 20 minutes later and not one visit from the manager or any offer to comp anything. I didn't really mind paying full price but someone other than my server should have paid a visit to our table. Im sure i could have had all the above had i acted a fool but i chose to not do that and see how they handled it and was greatly disappointed. So, needless to say that was my last visit to Applebees....

Went to this Applebee's it was bad, ate the food it was chicken and it had cucumber on it was bad, than my wife tried to pay on phone with credit card. They said no calls on card, manager was very rude to me and my wife he needs to be fired. He didn't even say here a coupon . For next visit my wife was very upset about he behaved he said he will not take credit card on phone. My family will not be going back. Lost a good family where there three times this week. Will be going to ruby Tuesday . Sad when a manager can make a company look bad. Needs to be replace .

LOVE Applebee's!  I always love going there and eating their food, have never had an issue with a wrong order or food being prepared improperly.  Service has always been prompt and friendly and understandable during times they are packed, like on Veteran's Day.   As a Veteran myself, I commend Applebee's on their celebration of Veteran's Day!

Came here tonight after debating here or the IHOP next door, place wasn't that busy around 9pm, ordered the sirlon with garlc shrimp, my dad got an appetizer since they were half off, 2 regular drinks.. we were surprised the bill came back at $33 and wondered when Applebee's got so pricey. We could see why the apps were half off because I don't think people would pay $24 for an app. Other than that the food was average chain-style food, the service was fair, this Applebee's is much better than there Martinsburg location. They also have fairly late hours which is great for night owls like myself, and they also have a few menu items which list the calories for anyone watching there waistline.

Last time I will ever eat there.  I ordered carry out and when i pulled up i saw the cook smoking outside the carry out door. Then i followed him in the door and watched him go back to work without washing his hands. Gross. Then the manager (ashley) was at the carry out cash register with an un-lit cigarette hanging out of her mouth. These people are gross and stupid considering 70% of the population does not smoke.  This Applebees is a mess.

Felt like giving this restaurant a review simply because its the best Applebees I've been in around here. Walked in and immediately did a double take, English speaking friendly employees? No way, I thought, I must have missed something. Nope sure didn't, staff was amazing right from the start. So nice to be greeted in plain English with a smile. No other area applebees has that bragging right. Food was better than the other locations I've tried, service was by far the best, staff must be from another planet, I've simply never had that kind of service in an applebees, they were phenomenal. Open til midnight too which is cool and they don't try and shove you out the door like most places do an hour before closing time. I don't normally go to wv for anything, I make a special trip now though anytime I want applebees.
Good food. Steak wasn't cooked as ordered. Service was great. I'd go back if in the area. Typical chain restaurant experience and food.
Went the other night and had boneless buffalo wings and some other stuff.  I always forget I hate the crap they sprinkle on the hot!

Meh.  Disappointing.  I came here wanting a good salad and it was drowning in dressing and the chicken was bland.  And I should've just flushed $ down the drain rather than wasting it on the low-cal margarita.  I will not be back here any time in the near future.

We have tried this place so many tImes and it's always bad. We gave up after my wife got very I'll after eating the fish and when or waitress hung on to our credit card. She had it in her apron wrapped in receipts. We had to goo back to ask for it, got suspicious, mentioned it to the manager only to be dismissed with a quick"okay I'll take to her about it". Then he was off to seat some other victims, I mean customers.

came here for mother's day, taking my in-laws and wife out to lunch. oh boy, where do i start. there is several very inappropriate expletives i can use for how our server treated us, she had absolutely no interest in hearing us out, which is why it was no surprise that we were missing 2 salads and an appetizer when our order came (mind you in shouldn't take roughly 35 minutes of sitting there to just get appetizers), then she was very rude when we made a comment about it. i guess someone didn't understand the concept of working for tips. then finally after almost an hour of waiting, our actual entrees arrived. i ordered a medium rare steak with garlic shrimp. the steak was warm and red/pink in the middle, which was cool, but one entire of side of the steak is charred BLACK to the point of where is was inedible. also it had no flavor or texture to the meat, telling me it had frozen and thawed several times over. same story with my wife's chicken. HEY CRAPPLEBEE'S THERE IS A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A "SEAR" AND "STRAIGHT UP CHAR/BURNT". the rice the that was served with my mother-in-law's and wife's meals were not only obviously tossed in a microwave, dried out, and several days old. i mean if you are going to reheat rice, at least throw some water or butter in with to rehydrate it. but the rice was also luke-warm/cold, which was also unacceptable. after i complain to my server, to who NO SURPRISE had no interest in hearing me out, went to get a manager who took another 15 minutes of my time with my family for mother's day to even get to the table. all i got from him was "i'm sorry, i'll only charge you for the appetizers and drinks, and next time your meal is on us" to which i responded "i'm not paying dime due to (all stated above), and won't be back for 'another meal on you' as a matter of fact you should pay me for the ridiculous amount of time i have wasted on poor service and crap food''.  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS APPLEBEE'S BRANCH TO ANYONE, AND WILL NOT BE RETURNING.

Decided to stop by the friendly neighborhood grill, glad that I did. I haven't step foot in one in ages (approximately 6years). The overall experience was great, thanks to the friendly bartender. She provided expectational service and never once strayed from quality service.  Half way through my meal, three gentlemen were trying to do some attempting to split the ticket in a very complicated way, she did as they stated and when they got the bill, they began to argue that she screwed it up and that she was at fault, she apologizes and walked them through their request and redid the bill.  AMAZING!! Normally nowadays, servers just argue and take a defensive stance (which she has every right too; however, decided the smoother approach).   When people around us food started to come out before us, she apologized and went to the back to see why our order was taking longer than the others.  A few minutes followed and out came the food.  I ordered the 'All-Day Brunch Burger' As it sat in front of me I was disappointed at its appearance and quickly suspected that it would be subpar.  Nonetheless, to my surprise, it was a perfect blend of cheese, meat, hash brown taste.   A colleague of mine, ordered a sirloin with mashed potatoes and he expressed the same thoughts, appearance wise not appealing and worrisome, however, filled with flavor and very tender according to him. Recommend this location as a quick beer and burger place!

Would have been zero stars - but would not let me!  Ordered for pickup and when got home with food my burger was bread and meat only.  I had ordered the classic burger with lettuce, tomato, pickle and onion. Also ordered with no pink in the meat- meat was very pink.  When I called I was told the order online showed to remove the veggies - I explained that my ticket did not show that and was told that was what the order showed.  Horrid service - will not be back EVER!

I'm not normally a fan of chain restaurants, but was with a group, and didn't want to be the naysayer.  Our group got seated promptly, and our server was fantastic.  Drinks were kept filled, and she was attentive without being annoying.  I ordered the All-Day Brunch burger, and it would have been amazing, except, I specifically asked for ketchup on the side (It's advertised on the burger), and the server confirmed - On the side (I wanted it for my fries).  The burger had ketchup on it.  Small detail, but I was not happy about ketchup with the egg on the burger.  Then, I had also ordered their 4 cheese Macaroni and cheese.  She brought out a bowl of M&C from a grocery store box, not the one that was on the menu.  I mentioned that it wasn't the right item, she came back a minute later with the right one.  I did leave with a full stomach, but was not thrilled.

Dined at Applebee's in Charles Town, WV last night and was very disappointed.  Cody, the server, was good and the Mgr tried.  I had ordered a sirloin steak, medium rare.  I got it medium well.  I mentioned it to the server and he took it and said he'd get me another.  35 minutes later he brought me a medium steak.  By this time my GF and her son were done with their meals.  So we just left.   I gave 2 stars because Cody was good and the Mgr, at least, tried.  I'd give the "cooks" negative 5 stars.  They have no idea how to cook steaks.  If you go to the Charles Town Applebee's...... have a burger.

I came here with a friend and ordered a mixed drink. We're on vacation, so I asked the bartender if I could get two shots. She said "You can't order a shot unless you get a beer." "So I need to get a beer?" "Yes, it's a WV law and you have to finish those first." So I finish my drink and order my beer and a shot and in talking with the people next to me they point out someone has ordered a whiskey on the rocks. I say to the lady "could I have gotten a whiskey on the rocks?" She says "no, it's considered a shot." "Well he has one." "Oh, well yeah you can do that if that's all you're drinking." "That's all I ordered. That's all I wanted. I don't want a beer." "Oh I'm so sorry. I misunderstood. I'll take the beers off." No you didnt... you just tried to take advantage of out of towners. Nice job Applebees. The food was decent at least.
This was a good restarant.  The food was good the waitress was very nice the food came out on time right behind the appetizers I would eat at this restaurant again.

Definitely not the same vibe as glory days. Saw some clown with a locust bill golf course shirt and Florida gator hat and he really hit a nerve. Dude acted like he owned the place. He came in slapping people on their shoulder, who I could clearly see that had the same opinion of this joke that I did. I don't really see how this person will ever marry or has any friends I guess that's why he was eating alone and the guy he sat next to left within five minutes of him being there.  Food was pretty good and bartender let me charge my phone so that was cool

Good service and a friendly laid back easy atmosphere. The menu is pretty easy to follow and there's nothing especially bold or complicated about this place, typical bar food or quick bite style dining American influenced with a few healthier options. The 2 for 20 is a great deal and otherwise the prices are really reasonable. Don't order a steak, this is not outback and you will be disappointed stick with a burger or chicken tenders and fries and a beer and you'll be full and happy when you leave.

I don't hold high regards for chain restaurants but this Applebee's is possibly one of the reasons why i try not to.  Let's start with the service- we waited at a empty host station waiting to be seated for about 2 minutes. 2 minutes isn't that long but during dinner time...to leave the host station unattended, come on management.  As for the food, everything came out burnt and steak came out medium rare when we asked for medium well.  I know the cooks didn't graduate from CIA but how do you mess that one up? Servers?  If you dislike your job that much, find another one, it's so obvious you would rather be elsewhere.  Please, my food tastes so much better if you weren't scowling every time you came by reluctantly to ask how our food was...  The only saving grace?  Lots of space (due to tables not in use) and equally awesome parking because there aren't many cars.

Food is ok.. prices decent. Recently renovated but now they have iPads on the tables which is annoying when you have two kids that rather play then eat.  I had them remove it but the kids whined to play. You have to pay to play... doesn't invite family time!

Been here for an hour just got our appetizer. Can only imagine how long dinner will take. Makes me remember why we never eat here anymore. At least most of the food was hot when we got it. The tables around us got their food before us and ours finally came it was so over done it was inedible. Told them to take it all off of our bill. Will never be back for real this time.

I give the entire chain an F minus. The previous time I came I had one of the worst steaks I've ever been served from any restaurant. Sent it back three times and still was not appetizing enough to eat. THAT WAS 10 YEARS AGO. Last night I decided to try again... absolutely disgusting. I don't know where they source their meat, but it must be the absolute cheapest they could find. Bottom quality beef. You can mistake it for pork it is so pale. Looking for a good steak? ANYWHERE else is a good start.

The shrimp was undercooked, the salad was limp, the cabbage in the salad was the core of the cabbage, the potatoes we partly rotten. Several tables were getting refunds while we were there. They should be closed
New menu allows for building your own appetizers. That's s good thing. Service is still sub par and food not quite up to an extra star.
Worst Applebee's ever. Got 3 orders of cold fries. Fried mushrooms were cold in middle. Steak was dried out and overcooked. Keep sending food back. Horrible waitress, horrible service

Worst customer service manager is so rude he needs to grow up and be a man not a 2 year old .you could not paid me to go there. The food was wrong he didn't care. So here is your no problem manger please go somewhere yet so we can have great customer service until then you will not get my money

Food is irrelevant when reviewing restaurant chains because once you've been to one, you've been to 'em all. What makes the difference is the service and atmosphere and this location receives a great rating from me. Football fan wise-I bleed purple while my friend is a Steelers fan (no accounting for taste, I know). So, with last Sunday being the first time of the season where Steelers & Ravens both had games at 1pm, it was imperative that we both had the ability to watch our respective football games.  We walked in and the gates of football game heaven opened up. The bar had FIVE flat screens surrounding the bar perimeter AND a big projector screen in the middle of the bar section. Score and DOUBLE Score! I tried to work my charm on Lisa the bartendress to see if we could switch the Ravens game to the big screen but unfortunately the store manager was a Skins fan so that game got projector and sound system priority. No biggie. Customer service was excellent. Lisa was engaging and when I sent my dish back due to slightly translucent shrimp, a pleasant elderly lady with a beehive doo came out to apologize and asked if everything was okay with the redo. I assumed she was the grill master because I saw her bringing out all the skillet dishes. When our next trip to Hollywood casino falls on a Saturday into football Sunday, we plan to come back here to watch all the games at this sports bar like Applebee's. By the way, it's located just a few short minutes away from the casino.

Wow......really awful experience.  We came hungry...having had a couple of teenagers just come off the river rafting experience and came here to eat.  Few tables filled, ( I thought because it was in between lunch and dinner) but I don't think so.   I realize eating here is not a dining experience, but this was just a very disappointing experience.  We ordered off the two for 20 and two for 25 then had another regular order at our table.  The first app came out ok, the second salad came out and our spinach dip did not.  We were told they were making fresh chips.  OK...sounded good.  Well, after we asked our server who kept apologizing...where our app was...oh it's coming.  Finally....it appeared, with "freshly made chips" that were all stuck together and full of grease.  One of my dining peers ordered a steak-medium, it was so well done,  and totally BROWN.  Finally, Brian the manager came over and apologized offering to make her another one...or something else.  By that time, we had been there forever she just refused his offer and ate the mashed potatoes.  I had ordered fried shrimp, that were definitely like the frozen ones from the grocery store..mediocre I guess I should have known better and ordered a hamburger or something else.   Positives:  Brian was very nice and apologetic and did credit several items from our bill.  Server also very nice.  Spinach and artichoke dip was tasty, mashed potatoes, chicken strips were good and wedge salad was ok.    That's about it..... Also, not to mention there were more than 4 or 5 flies flying around the entire time.  I'm sure this is due to the horse track across the street BUT it's really gross.....

A pretty good Applebee's.  Burger and sweet potato fries were hot and delicious.  Grilled Chicken salad was fresh and tasty.  Soda refills were prompt and service was friendly.  About what we expected when we stopped.

It's a standard Applebee's so I recommend sitting at bar when Kim is the bartender.  Kim is nice, attentive and knows her stuff behind the bar!  We're from out of town but when we come back we'll make sure we return when Kim is working.
